intro: Coccoloba caurana, commonly known as the red mangrove or red mangrove tree, is a flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America, typically found in coastal areas and brackish water environments. The plant has distinctive red, waxy leaves that help it withstand saltwater conditions. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in spikes and are pollinated by wind. The plant plays an important role in stabilizing coastal ecosystems and providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial species.
